boardgame.name: He Hemetera Thalassa, Mare Nostrum
He Hemetera Thalassa, Mare Nostrum: Fast Play Rules for Fleet Action Ancient Naval Warfare in the Age of the Galley
boardgame.description:
He Hemetera Thalassa, Mare Nostrum
A quick playing set of fleet action level Ancient naval rules covering the period 2000BC to 900AD, allowing large scale battles such as Salamis, Actium and the battles of the Peloponnesian and Punic Wars to be completed in a couple of hours or less.

They have been written with 1/2400 scale models based in groups or stands, with each stand representing 5 to 10 ships. A range of suitable 3D models are available for free download to accompany the rules.

Bookkeeping is minimal, using simple markers to indicate ship damage and crew casualties.

Data for over 30 different broad ship types and nine different fleet lists are included, from the Egyptians and Sea Peoples, through classical Greek and Roman to fleets and ships.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Conflict & Chaos: Vietnam 1965
boardgame.description:
Conflict and Chaos: Vietnam 1965 is a historical strategic board game designed by James J Campbell and published by I Will Never Grow Up Games.

On 2 March, 1965, following an attack on a US Marine barracks at Pleiku, Operations Flaming Dart, Rolling Thunder and Arc Light commenced. This intense bombing campaign, which ultimately lasted three years, was intended to force North Vietnam to cease its support for the National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam.

Ultimately, the US involvement in the war in Vietnam was ineffective. On 15 January, 1973, President Richard Nixon announced the suspension of US offensive action against North Vietnam. By wars end, the Vietnamese had been fighting foreign involvement or occupation for 116 years.

Take control of the nine major powers involved in one of the most controversial conflicts of all time. Can you change the course of history?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ptolus: Monte Cook's City by the Spire (5E)
boardgame.description:
"Ptolus: Monte Cook's City by the Spire, the classic and much beloved campaign setting, returns for 5e and Cypher System fans. We're reissuing the whole, deluxe product in two versions, one for each of these popular, critically acclaimed game systems."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Gamemastery Guide NPC Pawn Collection
boardgame.description: Unleash an Army of NPCs! The spotlight isn't always on heroes or monsters. Some encounters call for a whole cast of nonplayer characters, and the Pathfinder Gamemastery Guide NPC Pawn Collection is the best way to bring the most useful and commonly encountered NPCs to your gaming table! This value-packed collection contains every NPC presented in the Pathfinder Gamemastery Guide, and is perfect for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any fantasy RPG. NPCs include beggars, guards, judges, jailers, pirates, a cult leader and cultists, innkeepers, executioners, surgeons, bandits, torchbearers, acrobats, and more. Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from the Pathfinder Pawns Base Assortment, making them easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. The Pathfinder Gamemastery Guide NPC Pawn Collection is the best way to ensure you've got the perfect character for every Pathfinder Roleplaying Game encounter! (From the back cover of the package)

boardgame.name: Sly Flourish's Fantastic Adventures: Ruins of the Grendleroot - The Call of Starsong Tower
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a thousand thousand years, an ancient entity has been trapped in the heart of a mountain formed from rock not of this world. Over eons, creatures both monstrous and intelligent have explored the endless tunnels, caverns, and chambers of Blackclaw, answering the call of the mysterious entity buried within it. Over long centuries, hundreds of lairs, cities, keeps, prisons, and tombs were established within the mountain, but even those centuries of exploration did not uncover all its secrets.

Then, two centuries ago, the entity now known as the Grendleroot awoke.

Indestructible black spires shot through the rock of the mountain like the roots of a deadly weed, shattering civilizations, burying cities, and exposing caverns long lost. Today, adventurers residing in Deepdelver’s Enclave explore these lost ruins once again. They seek fellow adventurers brave enough to answer the call of Blackclaw, and to seek the mysteries of the Grendleroot.

Call of Starsong Tower is a free 1st level adventure for the 5th edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game. This is the first of ten adventures available in Fantastic Adventures: Ruins of the Grendleroot.

boardgame.name: Downtime Destinations: The Smoke Road Shanty
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“This little eatery may look like a roadside shack, but your tongue will think the food came right from the king's own table. Pure gold bought for only a few coppers.”
- Alan Bigry, retired royal chef and wayfaring connoisseur

After traveling the well-worn Boulderway Road on their way to one of two adjacent kingdoms, weary adventurers have the opportunity to park their wagons at the junction and try the best barbecue that the realms have to offer at the Smoke Road Shanty. And although the owners themselves aren’t the bragging types, the steady stream of satisfied customers more than speak to their culinary talents.

This supplement includes:

Information on The Smoke Road Shanty, the realm's best barbeque shack!
New NPCs to introduce to your Players.
A spicy new challenge to pit your PCs against.
Rumors and plot hooks.

boardgame.name: Sly Flourish's Fantastic Adventures: The Night Blade
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ralavaz the Night Blade, a notorious bandit chieftain, has been released from prison. Rumors mark him as having returned to the hideout from which he and his band once operated—a ruined watchtower where a new group of bandits now dwells. The local sheriff believes that Ralavaz's return means the Night Blades are back—and that the bandit chieftain must be stopped for good.

The Night Blade is a free 1st level adventure for your 5th edition fantasy roleplaying game. It is one of ten adventures from the book Fantastic Adventures.

boardgame.name: Birthright
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our party of "wizards" are headed off across the desert to give tidings to a newborn ruler. This was our Christmas episode...you can see where it is going!

The scenario was designed for a trio of ninth level PCs. This offering was a fantastic time for the Murder Hobo Inc. podcast show on Twitch.

boardgame.name: The Spiritual Path
boardgame.description:
The Spiritual Path is a boardgame of Spiritual Ascension uniting the Paths of Science, Religion, Philosophy & Occult Mysticism.

Players work to balance Coin of the Realm as they ascend the 3 Planes (Physical, Astral & Mental) while gaining 'knowledge & experience' upon many different Paths.

Players will encounter challenges on LIFE Cards, including rare Magic and Siddhi cards, as well as the Teachers of the Middle Pillar, Crisis Points, Dark Nights of the Soul and more.

Players who are able to open all 9 Petals in the Egoic Lotus are free to walk the Rainbow Bridge and win the game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Zettex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters provides game stats for the Zettex, an alien race that has mercilessly conquered entire sectors of space and committed numerous instances of interstellar genocide. They are villains not to be trifled with.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Manual of Mutants & Monsters: Zettex

boardgame.name: Rus'
boardgame.description:
Rus' is set somewhere in Russia during the 'Time of Troubles.' The king has fallen, but has left no one to take his place! This sparks interest in even the poorest people of Rus'. As a peasant in this game, each player works their way up the classes to gain royalty in hopes of taking over the kingdom.

This is a 2 - 4 player game that plays in about 45 minutes. It's a secret identity building game. Not like your ordinary secret identity games. You will claim to be whatever character you please (carry out their ability) and build up your estate. Just don't get caught lying by the other players! Action cards will also help you gain advantage by building on your property or even by attacking others.

The game ends when someone buys there way into becoming the king, but the winner is whoever accumulates the most Royal Points. Anyone who claims 10 Royal Points before the King is bought will win automatically.

boardgame.name: Death in Knossos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement for Faeries Wear Boots is a Saga set in Crete at the middle period of The Minoan Civilization. The main location is the Palace of Knossos, home of the fabled Minotaur.

Knossos, the Jewel of the Aegean, before the Bronze Age Collapse
Two detailed adventure areas
2-6 session Saga for 4 or more players
Over 40 Age of Gods NPCs
Intrigue, mystery role-playing in the Age of Gods

boardgame.name: Vokt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Races of Center Space 5: Vokt is the sixth volume in a series playable races for the 5th Edition rules. Each race in the series is from the Center Space setting. While the Center Space is a science fiction setting, the races can easily be used with other genres.

This volume presents the Vokt—hulking beasts of incredible physical and mental strength.

This book contains a racial description and a new racial feat for the Vokt, as well as suggestions for adapting it to other settings.

boardgame.name: Kechek
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Races of Center Space 5: Kechek is the eighth volume in a series playable races for the 5th Edition rules. Each race in the series is from the Center Space setting. While the Center Space is a science fiction setting, the races can easily be used with other genres.

This volume presents the Kecheck—a race of multi-armed insectoid warriors.

This book contains a racial description and a new racial feat for the Kechek, as well as suggestions for adapting it to other settings.

boardgame.name: The Crystal Hearts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Scalding Wastes of Kavva’tak lie west of the Valdu’vae Barrier Peaks, an inhospitable stretch of sand and rock. With the day comes the unforgiving sun and the nights the biting cold. One hopes to find respite among the scant refuges offered to a weary traveler crossing these sands. The Oasis of the Swallow in Flight is among the few along the northern passage that provided safe harbor. That was until the scattered reports of the deadly encounters with wild monkey-like beasts. Only the desperate and foolish now dare to add this stop… unless they heard word of what else was discovered, a crystalline treasure found within the rocky embankments.

The Crystal Hearts is a combat encounter, ranging from medium to deadly in difficulty for four to six players, averaging 9th level.

boardgame.name: The Peasants Have Lost Their Minds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A classic HP Lovecraftian adventure set in a fantasy genre. Filled with Mi-Go and other odd Lovecraftian monsters and strange villagers. Delve into this dungeon, Lovecraft-style.

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: British Ace Pilot – Pierre Closterman
boardgame.description:
This expansion includes ace pilot Pierre Clostermann.

He was a French flying Ace and joined the Free French Air Force in the United Kingdom in March 1942. After training at RAF Cranwell and 61 OTU, Clostermann, a sergeant pilot, was posted in January 1943 to No. 341 Squadron RAF (aka Groupe de Chasse n° 3/2 "Alsace"), flying the Supermarine Spitfire.

Throughout the war he became very well decorated and scored 33 recorded victories (19 solo, 14 shared, most of them against fighters) and five "probables", with eight more "damaged".
He also claimed 225 motor vehicles destroyed, 72 locomotives, five tanks, and two E-boats (fast torpedo boats).
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Royal Air Force
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Treasures of the Spheres
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Treasures of the Spheres is a massive compendium of premade magic items, designed to work with games using Ultimate Spheres of Power and Spheres of Might for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game (1st Edition).

In this book, you’ll get over 100 pages filled with content like:
• A Crafting Tradition system that adds benefits and penalties to items based on how they’re made
• Apparatuses that grant powerful ongoing bonuses for characters
• A huge expansion of metamagic for Ultimate Spheres of Power
• Numerous consumable items
• Powerful implements ready to boost a caster’s level in a sphere
• Marvelous items with daily uses and a brand-new system for improving them over time so they can be given to players as early as the start of the game
• Fabled items that demonstrate more and more power in the hands of the worthy
• Rare artifacts known as talent crystals that can instantly teach magical or martial skills
• Numerous new weapons, including guidelines on how to apply talent-like effects to them
• An in-depth guide on the techniques and principles for distributing items in games
• Random treasure tables separated by price
• ...And more!
As the comprehensive expansion of magical items for Ultimate Spheres of Power and Spheres of Might, Treasures of the Spheres has material for countless character styles and every level of play. Whether you’re looking for new ways to improve your character or want to surprise your players with fantastic new items, this incredible book has it all.

boardgame.name: The Blood and Portents Handbook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blood and Portents Handbook is a collection of archetypes, class options, talents, and more for expanding the Blood sphere and giving other thematic options for characters ranging from crafters of magical toys, masters of winter magic, and more.

Introduced in this book is a new Blood sphere power in the form of Blood Arts, as well as other powers allowing for forming blades from your own blood, binding a target in chains forged from their own blood, and more.

This handbook is designed to be used as a companion book with the updated Spheres of Power system of magic materials found in Ultimate Spheres of Power, as well as materials from Spheres of Might, Champions of the Spheres, and other Drop Dead Studio supplement products.

boardgame.name: Legacy Species Reforged
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment of Star Log.Deluxe includes: reforged versions of seven legacy races! Included within are dragonkin, dwarves, elves, gnomes, goblins, halflings, and orcs.

boardgame.name: Dijat
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Races of Center Space 5: Dijat is the ninth volume in a series playable races for the 5th Edition rules. Each race in the series is from the Center Space setting. While the Center Space is a science fiction setting, the races can easily be used with other genres.

This volume presents the Dijat—a race adapted to life in the desert, they are tough and virtually inexhaustible.

This book contains a racial description and a new racial feat for the Uhr, as well as suggestions for adapting it to other settings.

boardgame.name: The War for Heaven and Earth
boardgame.description:
The War for Heaven and Earth is a board game that pits the forces of Light versus the forces of Darkness. Players battle upon a huge map of Earth (Gaia) and move between the continents via Ports.

Players begin with an Ascended Master who creates Magicians and Knights who must all work to 'align the territorial planes' in Body, Mind & Spirit.

Players employ Strategy Cards and can simultaneously combine attacks from many squares upon one or more Planes, resulting in the potentially massive gain or loss of Energetic Units.

Players who control the greatest number of 'fully aligned' Territories when the 'Event' card is drawn win the game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Amazons Vs Valkyries: Warrior Cults
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within this file:

32 warrior cults, mercenary bands, and special operations units.

Each unit's strength, symbol, objective, creed, missions, and locations.

Campaign setting details (recruitment and monsters)

An updated campaign map

War is a way of life in the ancient world. Just as witches gather in covens to share arcane secrets, warriors with a shared purpose also form bonds of sisterhood to advance their common goals. These bonds lead to the creation of formal groups with rules and leaders, treasures and ambitions.

Joining a mercenary band is an extremely common career choice and recruiters are constantly searching for able-bodied candidates to fill vacancies. Characters may join one or more of these groups, or they may even be forced to join. Regardless of how they become members, they gain a large group of friends, connections, and compatriots on whom to rely. However, these associates may also come asking for favors or assigning work.

A few of the mercenary bands, elite units, and special operations groups covered in this file include:

The 10,000
Persian Immortals
Spartan Krypteia
Egyptian Medjay
Sacred Band of Thebes
Myrmidons
Poseidon Command
Leopard Society
Carian Contingent
Berserkers
Scythian Archers
The Sons of Mars
The Silver Shields
And of course, the Amazons and the Valkyries.

boardgame.name: Sidetrack Adventures Book 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

More adventures for your party with sidetrack adventures two. Each adventure is a stand alone, exciting romp into danger, excpet for the last one which is part two of the iron Wolf sage.

boardgame.name: Elemental Host
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fight With The Fury Of The Elements!

Elemental Hosts are warrior-shamans who wield elemental forces to devastate their foes, powered by a spiritual bond with an elemental spirit who now resides within them. Blast your enemies with elemental fire, conjure weapons made from lightning, or fuse with your stony spirit to become a living elemental! Revised for Pathfinder 2, the Elemental Host returns!

Includes:

The full elemental host base class for Pathfinder 2!
50+ class feats!
10 spirit spells, a new type of Focus Spell used by elemental hosts!
Elemental host multiclass archetype feats!

boardgame.name: Conspiracy Theories!
boardgame.description:
Conspiracy Theories is a card game that challenges players to link conspiracies into theories to bring disclosure to the world!


DRAW CONSPIRACY CARDS to simulate the endless hours of research required to become acquainted with the evidence.
GROUP BY CATEGORY: Study the Conspiracies to discover the hidden web linking them together by Category.
FORM A THEORY: Link 3 or more Conspiracies and play the Leading Theory.
BUMP THE LEADER: Bump the Leading Theory by producing even more evidence.
Use SMEAR CAMPAIGN CARDS *to muddy the water around a colleague.
Use DEBUNK CARDS *to permanently disprove a Category narrowing the search.
ACCUSE a colleague of *SUPPRESSING EVIDENCE *if you suspect that they hold the Debunk card to their own Theory.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: To The South: The Honshu War, 1950-53
向南进
boardgame.description:
The Honshu War, 1950-53 (HW) is a two-player, low-to-intermediate complexity, strategic simulation of the war that could have resulted had Japan ended up divided between Communist and US occupation forces at the end of World War II. The Soviet player is mainly on the offensive, attempting to win the game by seizing key objectives within the territory of the Western-allied Republic of Japan. At the same time, though, the situation allows for and at times demands the launching of sharp counteroffensives by the United Nations player.

Each hexagon on the map represents 25 miles (40 kilometers) from side to opposite side. The units of maneuver for both sides are divisions. Each full turn represents from one to two months, depending on the season. By seasonally telescoping time in that way, the turn-by-turn movement and combat capacities of the units can be held as a constant.

boardgame.name: Rangers of Arkwood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 4-6
For years, a benevolent group of hunters stalked the trails of Arkwood, keeping the forest clear of dangerous creatures. Now however the group has vanished, and some very concerned people want you to find out why.

boardgame.name: BESM Adventures Fourth Edition: Introductory Adventure Scenario
Carousel Obscura
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Carousel Obscura” is a two-part mystery and action adventure scenario for BESM Fourth Edition. The story takes place across two linked worlds: the modern-day, ordinary world of Molybdos and the magical fantasy world of Magenta. On Molybdos, the characters are normal college students without any notable powers. When they travel to Magenta, though, their special natures are unlocked and they gain supernatural abilities.

This scenario is ideal for 4 to 6 players at two distinct power levels – Human (40 Character Points) on Molybdos and Heroic (90 Character Points) on Magenta. As the GM, you will guide the characters through a series of trials and challenges as they seek to learn more about the two worlds and their destiny within. All this, while they discover that the veil between connected worlds may be weakening.

boardgame.name: IMP
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment will introduce a new organization IMP.

This organization is a group of assassins that have assassinated individuals all over the world. This organization is made up of 8 slightly crazy individuals. This material was originally presented in Villainy Codex III – Send In The Clowns

boardgame.name: Home to Roost
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Roustern family crypt has long sat unmolested in a cleverly hidden cut in the Saberandi Mountains. The underground tomb is home to their celebrated ancestors, a bloodline of gifted sculptors and stone cutters. In a manner befitting the family legacy, the inner chambers were fashioned with the precision and elegance these artisans became noted for among the kingdom’s elite. Beautifully chiseled life-like statues. Grand columns and walls decorated with ornate braids of ivy and delicate flowers. Flowing reliefs of dancing fauns and graceful sprites in full celebration. All to culminate in elaborate scenes of magnanimous glory and paralyzing rapture to fill your view. And, as a final nod to the craft’s secrets, shrewd traps to protect the inner sanctum from irreverent intruders. The task presented is a simple one... to intern one of their own. But nothing is ever that simple.

Home to Roost is a Q-Adventure, or Quick-Adventure, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 10th-level characters. The adventure takes place to the north of the city of Castiel. The runtime is about 4 hours and is Exploration Themed.

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #18 - Jun 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bexim’s Bazaar is a monthly gaming magazine dedicated to RPGs and wargames… and occasionally a boardgame of interest to RPG/wargamers. GMs and players will find plenty of resources such as magic item cards, random tables, mini-adventures, and articles related to gaming as well as printable props to hand out in game. This issue contains over 100 pages of gaming content for a variety of genres and games, and gamers are welcome to submit their own content for future issues (info on submitting is found inside each issue).

Here are the contents for Bexim's Bazaar Issue #18:


Bexim's Bazaar Pages


Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards

Treana’s Trinkets - d20 random list of trinkets each month

The Dented Helm - each month, 4 new adventure hooks

Hewbue’s Used Books - each month, 10-15 new book titles and authors

Racker’s Auction House - 6 new auction items with lore each month

Veach’s Spellbooks - each month, 2 new spellbooks with descriptions/cost

Dolbin’s Scrolls - 3 new magic scrolls to print and provide to players each month

The Mystic Baker - each month, a new menu prop to print and hand out to players

Wanted Poster - each month, a new Wanted Dead or Alive poster with an NPC

Deed - new printable prop each month related to owning property


The Skirmish Table Pages


Hazel’s Weapons Emporium - Seller of the best (unofficial) weapons and accessories for Gaslands

Skirmish Tabletop Gaming: New Norm - article on the rise of skirmish wargaming

Bushido by GCT Studios Review - review of the Bushido wargame

Enter the Jabberwock Key - an unofficial Frostgrave scenario

Unipolar Games Interview - interview with a maker of neoprene gaming mats and resources

What’s That Book Worth Anyway? - GM resource for determing materials and value of found books

Paper Realms: Long House Papercraft

A Swift Survey - mini-adventure and hand-made map from Bryan Swift

Adventure a Week Mini-Adventure - 2 page mini adventure

Kev’s Lounge Paper Miniatures - two paper miniatures to print and make for your game

False Documents - fictional documents for RPGs

Fat Dragon Games Papercraft

DM Scotty’s Wandering Monster

The Crumbling Corner (Terrain Craft) - How-to article to construct ruins

The Goblin Spider Walker (Terrain Craft) - How-to article to construct a mobile watchtower

Incorrigible IMPS - a monthly comic strip

boardgame.name: Carrion vs. Gator Gal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: Carrion VS Gator Gal provides two characters for your Mutants & Masterminds games: a villain, Carrion, and a hero, Gator Gal.

Carrion is the degenerate result of generations of back-bayou inbreeding. He is a reptilian-like serial killer and cannibal known for flying to deadly rages of bloodlust.

Gator Gal is Carrion's rebellious cousin. She has turned her back on her family's cannibalistic ways and uses her alligator-controlling abilities to track down and hopefully bring Carrion to justice. Includes individual and group alligator stats.

Each character is accompanied by three adventure ideas to make it easier to work them into your game.

boardgame.name: YOUniversal Monsters Omnibus (M&M3)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From Jacob Blackmon comes a new terrifying tome full of creepy and unusual foes ready to add a little chill to your M&M game!

Dracula... Frankenstein...The Mummy...

Jack Frost... Krampus...The Werewolf...

Names of legendary monsters whose stories are handed down through time - and creatures that can serve as villains (or perhaps, uncomfortable allies, under the right circumstances) for your heroes to face again and again.

YOUniversal Monsters Omnibus collects eight of these classic monsters from story and legend.

Within these pages are statistics and adventure seeds to help fit these monstrous villains into any superhero-themed campaign setting.

The monsters to be found in the YOUniversal Monster Compendium are new builds, designed to be supervillains in their own right. They are created at differing PLs (between 9 and 14) and have a variety of powers and abilities, ambitions, goals, and adventure ideas.

boardgame.name: Progress Report Issue Two
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Created initially during the lockdown caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, this ragtag collection of pieces, all SLA Industries orientated, should be considered the second issue of a 36-page SLA Industries magazine.

Within this document you will find two short pieces of fiction, a new Cannibal threat with four BPN ideas, ten BPN recipes, some Cannibal Sector fun and a stand-alone Shiver Print & Play game. Oh, and did we mention all-new art by Dave Allsop and Matteo Spirito? The Nightfall Games team hope that this will be enough to encourage you to stay indoors and prepare further for the upcoming SLA Industries 2nd Edition.

boardgame.name: Ruined Monastery
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the ruined monasteries in your campaign.

boardgame.name: The Broken Scales
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Quest designed for levels 1–4 (subtiers 1–2 and 3–4).

It's often debated whether Venture-Captain Drandle Dreng is dangerously erratic or simply uncannily unpredictable, but wherever he appears, chaos is sure to follow. When Dreng calls for a group of Pathfinders to help him check on the Society's kobold allies, the Sewer Dragons, what should have been a simple rendezvous turns into a chase through the sewers of Absalom to save the Society's scaley associates.

boardgame.name: Mistress of the Maze
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 5–8 (subtiers 5–6 and 7–8).

Open Decemvirate member Eliza Petulengro is looking for a handful of intrepid Pathfinders to accompany her on an interdimensional journey through the Maze of the Open Road! Eliza is traveling from the Grand Lodge in Absalom to the Woodsedge Lodge in Galt, but the Maze of the Open Road has become unstable and unpredictable in recent years. Eliza hopes that with help of her fellow Pathfinders, she can secure the road and prepare it for regular use by the Society once more.

boardgame.name: Locale: Desiderium
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Desiderium is an adult entertainment establishment located in Startown. It’s a place of provocative pleasures; to those in the know, it’s also a place of deception and secrets.

It’s easy to find. The proprietor, a former exotic dancer, has spent heavily on a state-of-the-art holographic display system linked to sophisticated personality-simulation software, allowing images of featured dancers to serve as virtual barkers. Inside, adult entertainment is featured in a reasonably clean, safe environment. Exotic dancing is the usual fare, but alcoholic beverages from many worlds flows freely, and private performance lounges can double as drug dens. It’s whispered that more unspeakable delights await those with the credits to pay for them.

This supplement for 2D6 games such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) takes a hard look at a typical Startown den of iniquity. Locale: Desiderium includes a brief discussion of its operating procedures, full CE/OSFRPG stats for the staff, and a detailed floorplan of the premises.

This product is for adult gamers only.

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: USAAF Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Blood Red Skies is constantly evolving with new aircraft, cards, rules and scenarios.

This pack gives you a good selection of US Airforce cards and profiles.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – United States Army Air Forces
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Ten Cents a Mile
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wealthy socialite Woodrow England has gone missing and his wife hires the PCs to find out where he’s gotten off to this time. The trail leads to a taxi ride in the middle of the night, a small-time punk always on the lookout for that big score, and a shadowy three-way battle between greed, patriotism, and domination. As the pals dig deeper into the mess, the realization comes that this time they may have bitten off more than they could chew.

Ten Cents a Mile is a short adventure for Midnight Boulevard: 2D6 Adventure in the World of Film Noir, which uses the rules for the Traveller SRD.

boardgame.name: The Edge of Cadascon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Starfinder Society Quest designed for levels 3-6 (subtiers 3-4 & 5-6).

The Triaxian city of Cadascon fell into ruin during the events of the Gap and since that time explorers have sought to uncover what happened. Finally, after centuries of trepidation by other organizations, the Starfinder Society has assembled a great expedition to inspect the outer edges of the devastated landscape. What horrors lie hidden past the borders of the sulfurous city and what power does its mysterious crystals portend for the future of Triaxus?

boardgame.name: Zombie Lords
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A deranged cleric has been ostracized by society as well as the magical community he was once an integral part of. This rogue cleric has retreated to an abandoned island to continue with his disturbing experiments. He has created a spell to create a new and more deadly form of zombie to be used by him as super-soldiers to aid him in his dark works. The mission is for the adventurers to destroy this evil wizard, his experiments, laboratory, and to find and bring can this unique BOOK OF NECROMANTIC ARTS to their employers. Can the PCs stop the madman’s horde of zombies and giant living creatures and destroy this madman’s laboratory? Or, will the PCs become part of this lunatic’s undead army?

boardgame.name: Cornered Rat
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Starfinder Society Quest designed for levels 9-12 (subtiers 9-10 & 11-12).

Beginning to glean the full insidious scheme enacted by its current foe, the Starfinder Society mounts a full-scale offensive against a recently discovered outpost in the Diaspora asteroid belt. Sending a powerful fleet and scores of experienced agents, the Society strikes out to learn the truth of its year-long foe: the mysterious and charismatic ysoki known as Datch. Within the Diasporan facility, the secrets of Datch's dastardly plan are laid bare and its full threat to the Starfinder Society and Pact Worlds will be revealed!

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: MiG Alley!
boardgame.description:
MiG Alley was the name given by the United Nations (UN) pilots to the northwestern portion of North Korea, where the Yalu River empties into the Yellow Sea.

The area's nickname was derived from the Soviet-built Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-15 flown by North Korea (some unofficially crewed by Soviet airmen) and the People's Republic of China airmen.

In response to the MiG threat the UN's P-51 Mustang squadrons began to convert to jet fighters... enter the North American F-86 Sabre.

The Mig Alley set contains all the aircraft cards, pilot discs, traits doctrine and equipment cards you need to take your games of Blood Red Skies in to the Jet Age!

A copy of the Blood Red Skies core box is required to use the contents of this set.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: US Ace Pilot – Boots Blesse
Blood Red Skies: US Ace Pilot – Royce Williams
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Korean War
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Dragon Lord
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mid-Level Fantasy Adventure
Intended for 4 to 6 player characters of levels 2 to 4

NORTHERN BARBARIANS HAVE LAID SIEGE TO A QUIET COASTAL VILLAGE.
THEY SEEK THE RETURN OF A GOLDEN DRAGON EGG, STOLEN LONG AGO.
YOU ARE CHOSEN TO FIND THE EGG IN THE TOMB OF THE DRAGON LORD.
CAN YOU SURVIVE THE TOMB, RETRIEVE THE EGG, AND STOP A WAR?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am happy to announce release “TOMB OF THE DRAGON LORD”; a mid-level one-shot adventure fantasy adventure intended for 4 to 6 seasoned adventurers of levels 2 to 4.

Synopsis: In this adventure your players are approached by a village sheriff who requests their aid.
A band of raiders from the north have laid siege to the village; the raiders are demanding the return of an ancient artifact (a golden dragon egg) they claims was stolen from their people by a long dead laird of these lands. This long dead sovereign is buried in a nearby barrow, and the sheriff (the laird’s direct ancestor) asks for the player’s help in retrieving said artifact.

A lot is riding on the players completing their quest, for if they do not return the artifact in time the barbarians sitting in the harbour have sworn to raze the village. Reinforcements won’t arrive in time to save the day, so it’s all down to our heroes. The players must travel to this ancient barrow mound, defeat its guardians and return with the egg to avert this war.

Can you players save the day!

This module is part of a new series of “generic” adventure from Starry Knight Press, written to be system agnostic and usable with OSRIC (& other OSR games), compatible with D&D 5E, and useable with any fantasy ruleset.

While aiming to offer a non-rules specific module, we do include Monster Statistic Blocks for both OSRIC and 5E in the appendices, to be useful to the majority of our readers. However, the GM will still need to refer to their gaming manual of choice for complete monster statistics and treasure descriptions.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: QuestWorlds System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

QuestWorlds is a rules and prep-lite RPG system that facilitates beginning play easily, and resolving conflicts in play quickly. It features an abstract, conflict-based, resolution method and scalable, customizable, character descriptions. Designed to emulate the way characters in fiction face and overcome challenges, it is suitable for a wide variety of genres and play styles.

This newsletter has an update on the products releasing in June 2020.

100 Strange Beliefs to Hold

100 Secret Societies
100 Encounters for a Fantasy Swamp
100 Encounters for a Fantasy Swamp (PFRPG)
Book Cover 5

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Air Strike!
boardgame.description:
Blood Red Skies: Air Strike! is a rules compendium that presents all of the rules from the original Blood Red Skies starter set and adds many new ones suitable for expanded air operations: ground and sea targets, bombing, strafing and torpedo attacks, defensive flak and terrain. Jet aircraft are introduced with the MiG Alley expansion and there is additional guidance for historic and competitive play.

The book includes seven entirely new scenarios for Blood Red Skies and re-presents the five existing ones to bring them in line with the new rules and player feedback.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nordwind 1945
boardgame.description:
Game covers operation Norwind, the last major German offensive operation at the western front during World War 2. The goal of the offensive was to break through the lines of the U.S. Seventh Army and French 1st Army in the Upper Vosges mountains and the Alsatian Plain, and destroy them, as well as the seizure of Strasbourg. If it'd happen, Germans planned to continue their attack on the rear of the American 3rd Army.

Additional scenarios pictures French attack on Colmar and American counterattack after the failure of the German offensive.

Game uses WB-95 system, regiment-scale, with American, French and German (regular and SS) units.

boardgame.name: Core Space: Rogue Purge
boardgame.description: What happens when the Purge disconnect from their masters? Resisting their conditioning and trying to blend in as humans, the new Rogue Purge NPCs may not be hostile at first but the time will come when they know too much! They can also be fielded as a Trader crew, with a unique new ability to craft their own equipment from its component parts, presenting plenty of new decisions about what to grab on a salvage run. Watch and learn about them in a series of thrilling new missions, and then add them to your regular games with the new Event Cards, useful Lock Counters, and wide range of new equipment.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Core Space

boardgame.name: Core Space: Shift Change At Megacorp
boardgame.description: Shift Change at MegaCorp is a civilian pack for Core Space that adds two new NPC types to the game. Workers will try to go about their business despite your interruptions, calling security and locking down their offices. Scavengers on the other hand are your direct competition, trying to loot the area before you can, and they can also be hired as Traders! Adapt your tactics in a series of thrilling new missions, and then add them to your regular games with the new Event Cards and wide range of equipment including new nano-tokens.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Core Space

boardgame.name: Clash Of Eagles, The German Two-Front War of 1939
boardgame.description:
Clash of Eagles combines Europa games 'Fall of France' (FoF) and 'Case White' (CW). This scenario allows Europa Buffs to explore a historical 'what-if:'

"What would have happened if the West had been more aggressive while the Wehrmacht was invading Poland?"

This scenario mainly uses rules from FITE/SE (Fire-in-the-East & Scorched Earth) and adds a number of optional 'Bro' rules for added enjoyment. Certain charts and Orders-of-Battle(OB's) are also needed from FoF and CW. It further requires a rather extensive collection of other Europa items, like specific issues of Bill Stone's ETO fanzine for updated OB's for specific combatants.


Note: For full 'Bro' rules experience, some counters need to be fabricated and are not included.


Contents:

Clash of Eagles ground rules, Part I - 8 pages
Clash of Eagles air rules, Part II - 4 pages
Clash of Eagles naval rules, Part III - 0 pages (not used)
Clash of Eagles political rules, Part IV - 4 pages
Clash of Eagles German OB, Part V - 3 pages
Clash of Eagles Allied OB, Part VI - 6 pages

5 Card Stock Charts:

2 x Bro rules aircraft counters in B&W
1 x 1 page, two sided (front & back), CRT along with 'Bro' Tables
1 x German Off-map Display
1 x Allies Off-map Display
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Case White: The Invasion of Poland, 1939
The Fall of France

boardgame.name: Core Space: Dangerous Days
Core Space: Une époque dangereuse
boardgame.description:
The galaxy is fast heading for a new dark age. Although dealt a serious blow the Purge are fighting back and they're winning. Worlds shut their borders, trade routes close and travel between sectors is met with hostility.

The Purge are virtually unchallenged and are sweeping through sector after sector. In these desperate times the Traders are forced to take more dangerous jobs for less gain.

Life is hard but so are the Traders; this is where they are at their best, fighting impossible odds and scraping a living. In a galaxy where the authorities are ignoring the real dangers and the soldiers stand by idle a new type of hero is needed.

Maybe you are that hero…

Dangerous Days is a supplement for Core Space: The Sci-fi Miniatures Game. This book expands the sandbox and adds whole new layers to the game. Up the difficulty of your campaigns, interact with a wider range of terrain, and play through the epic new Dangerous Days narrative. Time to start up the ion drive and re-enter Core Space!

This book contains:


New Campaign Rules: Crank it up to 11 as the new galactic conditions force your crew into life-changing decisions.
New NPCs: Add Workers and Scavengers to your games and adapt your tactics to overcome the new challenges.
Rogue Purge: What happens when the Purge disconnect from their masters? Watch and learn as they invade your board as NPCs and then take control of them as a new Trader crew!
New Special Rules: Add new terrain types to your games and find new ways to interact with your surroundings.
Core Space FAQ: All the answers you need to streamline your Core Space experience.
The Dangerous Days Campaign: 8 narrative missions in which you will infiltrate mighty corporations and reluctantly ally yourself with the galactic police!
New Mission Briefings: Over 15 additional standalone missions collated from the Mission Monday archives!
Painting Guide: Get some top tips and colour schemes from the painter of the Battle Systems studio minis!


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Core Space

Pokémon Trading Card Game Battle Academy
boardgame.description: Battle Academy is designed to be easy to learn and fun to play for all types of Trainers, including children and parents that may be new to the Pokémon TCG. Pokémon has a unique ability to bring people together, and we look forward to seeing families enjoy Battle Academy at their next game night, as parents bond with their kids over one of their favourite entertainment brands and collectible Pokémon TCG cards.

boardgame.description: Includes 10 Treasure Cards and 10 Conquest Cards that add more variables to the game. The Treasure Cards act as wild cards to allow for more card combos during play. The Conquest Cards represent unique events that take place and are acted upon immediately once drawn.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A War of Whispers

boardgame.name: A Postcard From Afthonia
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time, two seemingly different creatures decided to have a baby. (Such things are possible in the Lands of Dream.) But it was a time of revolution and war, and they were worried about their baby’s future, so they asked you to help them seek the wisdom of the Oracle…

A Postcard From Afthonia is a short excursion to the Isle of the Sun via the means of a magical portal. Said portal connects to events that take place after The Sea Will Claim Everything, but can be nevertheless be used by someone who has not taken that journey yet.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Bouncing Chess
Le Fast Slingpuck
The Fast Slingpuck
Quick Puck mini
SlingPuck
Soccer Bouncing Chess
boardgame.description:
Pass all the pucks through the center gate to the opposite side! The rapid-shot gameplay makes pass the puck a hit at birthday parties, game night, camping trips and more so the whole family can unplug and enjoy hours of fun.


Choose your opponent and face each other.
Place 5 pucks on each side of the board and You are ready to go! Start slinging the pucks with the elastic band as fast as possible to your opponent's side.


Win by clearing your board completely!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Edge of Tomorrow (All You Need Is Kill): The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Earth is under attack and its up to you or you and your team to find and stop the Omega. Every day you die to only fight the same battle over and over again but with the knowledge of what is to come. Acquire the skills, weapons and knowledge to survive and you can find the Omega, stop the loop and save the day.

Edge of tomorrow is 1 to 4 player Deck building, exploration and memory game. Using some core deck building mechanics and putting a twist on exploration games, Edge of tomorrow brings alive the idea of not only buffing yourself up but learning your surrounding and strategically planning your plays. Each hand is a new life so make of it what you can.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Johnny Red's Falcon Squadron
boardgame.description:
Johnny Red was Battle's longest-running series over 13 years, written by Tom Tully and drawn initially by Joe Colquhoun, later by John Cooper and finally by Carlos Pino, (and more recently by Garth Ennis) about a British fighter pilot Johnny "Red" Redburn flying for the Russians in a 'stolen' Hawker Hurricane fighter.

Falcon Squadron features a new card that will make playing against them a potentially difficult challenge!
The General Secretary often took a direct interest in aircraft production.
You play the 'Telegram from Stalin' card during deployment, allowing VVS planes in one designated squadron to disregard the Poor Quality trait in this battle.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Soviet Air Force
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Red Army Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Blood Red Skies is constantly evolving with new aircraft, cards, rules and scenarios.

This pack gives you a good selection of Soviet cards and profiles.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Soviet Air Force
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Sandstorm
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Western Desert! It’s November 1942, the Afrika Korps is in full retreat after the decisive battle of El Alamein. Ahead of the pursuing 8th Army the RAF’s Desert Airforce seek to pound the Axis forces from the air as they flee towards the Libyan-Tunisian border.

A desperate struggle for air superiority rages as RAF Spitfires and Tomahawks confront predatory Luftwaffe Bf109s and the deadly Fw190 only just arriving in the desert theatre.

Sandstorm is a two-player campaign system for Blood Red Skies, pitching you headfirst into the swirling furball over the Egyptian and Libyan deserts. You’ll take the role of a British & Commonwealth wing commander, or a German Oberstleutnant, managing your squadrons of pilots as they soar across the desert sands!
Pilots will grow in stature over the course of the campaign, starting out as untested rookies and hopefully ending as battle-hardened aces.

Every single engagement, however large or small will give your pilots the chance to make a name for themselves. This campaign system is designed to work alongside the brand new Air Strike! supplement, using several of the new scenarios and the rules for attacking ground targets to great effect.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Campaign Pack
boardgame.description:
Strafe the Allied forces storming up the beach-head,
fly reconnaissance missions,
sink battleships
and much more in these varied Blood Red Skies, originally part of the D-Day 75th Anniversary Campaign scenarios.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Imperial Japan Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Blood Red Skies is constantly evolving with new aircraft, cards, rules and scenarios.

This pack gives you a good selection of Imperial Japanese cards and profiles.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Imperial Japanese Air Force
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: F4U Corsair Squadron
boardgame.description:
The F4U flew over 60,000 operational sorties (only 9,000 sorties flown from carrier decks) for the U.S. Navy & Marines and U.S. Navy through the war (some 40% of total fighter sorties), with only 9,581 sorties (15%) flown from carrier decks.
Corsairs claimed 2,140 air combat victories against 189 losses to enemy aircraft, for an overall kill ratio of over 11:1.
It also proved its versatility, delivering over 70% of the total bombs dropped by U.S. fighters during the war.

This set gives you all you need to field a squadron of the F4U Corsair in your games of Blood Red Skies!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – United States Army Air Forces
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: German Ace Pilot – Otto Kittel
boardgame.description:
Otto Kittel flew first in Yugoslavia and then on the Eastern Front from June 1941 at the very outset of Operation Barbarossa.

He claimed his 100th aerial victory in September of 1943, his 150th in April of 1944 and his 200th in August the same year.

He was shot down and killed in action in February 1945 over the Courland Pocket, his final tally 267 victories over 583 combat missions.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Ptolus: Monte Cook's City by the Spire (Cypher)
boardgame.description:
"Ptolus: Monte Cook's City by the Spire, the classic and much beloved campaign setting, returns for 5e and Cypher System fans. We're reissuing the whole, deluxe product in two versions, one for each of these popular, critically acclaimed game systems."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Faction Fighters
boardgame.description:
A storm of Power Orbs mysteriously rains on the world. Lead a team of creatures in card power combat to claim valuable treasures and powerful Orbs. Activate abilities with perfect timing to crush the competition and become the area champion!

A game of Faction Fighters takes place at one of four unique area deck locations: Starfall Fields, Gem Hollow, Doomsday Bay, or Shard Peak. Compete each round for an event card by having the highest total strength of fighters. Simultaneously play a fighter to scout the field, then either choose to bolster with additional cards or hold back for future rounds. Plan your moves wisely- only one faction can join the fight each round. Obtain the most Victory Points by the end of the area deck to win.

Draft a custom deck from a pool of 15 different factions. Each faction has its own strategic flare, allowing fighters to unleash devastating ability combos. Swarm the field with a squad of snakes or control the future with mind reading koalas! Immerse yourself in the characters and story with the scenario comic book.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Clean Family
boardgame.description:
In Clean Family, players help their families to get what they need in the time of pandemic. There is a virus outbreak and no cure yet. Government issues lockdown and everyone should stay at home to contain the spreading.

Players need to help their Dad, Mom, Brother, Sister, Grandpa and Grandma get what they need. They will have to go to the market to get the items and draw them on their grid and then assign them to each Family member.

Clean Family is a simple flip and draw game for 1 to 4 players. The game is played over a series of round until all players played their cards. At the end of the game, players count all their points that they get from the symbols drawn on their player sheet, and player with the most points wins the game.

Clean Family is a simple flip and draw game but has deep decision making and interesting spatial placement.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Super Blood Harvest Omnibus Edition
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:

A trilogy of weird science-fantasy adventures from Dirk Leichty, the artistic visionary behind Silent Titans!

This trio of RPGs has been collected into a deluxe omnibus by Swordfish Islands, and is expected to begin shipping on May 1st, 2020. Limited to 1000 copies.

SUPER BLOOD HARVEST #1
You've been abducted by a VAMPIRE SPACE FORTRESS--escape before it enters hibernation behind the moon! (32 pages)

SUPER BLOOD HARVEST #2
You wake amid wreckage on the surface of the moon, at the foot of an abandoned temple. (44 pages)

SUPER BLOOD HARVEST #3
You are the last free humans of Mars, fugitives from hostile killbot swarms. A tile-crawl sandbox ruled by city-sized mechanical gods. (~70 pages)

boardgame.name: Communist Cats: Revolution
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Communist Cats: Revolution, the expansion for Communist Cats! Contains 24 cards to give the game play a new edge. Come join the revolution!

"The Physician" can help restore your numbers, meaning that there is always way back into the game.

Join up with "The Scientist", who can research new technologies to help you gain the advantage over your rivals. He allows access to 6 new Research Cards, but you have to be careful which technology you research and when or your rivals may gain access to even more powerful abilities!

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Communist Cats

boardgame.name: Murder on the Cards
boardgame.description:
Murder on the Cards is a quick play card game for 2 to 6 players that combines dark humour with the silly extremes of everyday irritants.

Each player is dealt 6 random Save Yourself cards and a Life Card at the start of the game, to be used against the To Your Demise Card scenarios that are presented on each turn. There are also To Your Demise cards that rely on a player's wit and luck alone. The Save Yourself cards counteract the various To Your Demise scenarios, but a player needs the correct Save Yourself card to survive, and if they don't have it, they can either barter with other players or gamble with the house deck. If you can't save yourself then you are Critically Hit and reduced to 1 Save Yourself card and your Life Card. After that, if the murderer gets you through the To Your Demise cards - you're toast.

The goal of the game is to last the longest against The Murderer. Every game is different, some result in a lone survivor and others leave everyone dead, but ultimately the last alive wins.

—description from the designer

NS
Title: Boss Monster Vault of Villains Publisher: Brotherwise Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: How to Serve Dragon and Other What's for Dinner Answers aka All About Fantasy Cuisine (World-Walker Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s a fantasy world, so they’re all the same, right? Merry Ole England but with magic, what else do you need to know? Seriously, if you agree with that then this is not the book for you!

OK, hopefully we got rid of all of “those” types. You’re still here so you probably care about things like world building, fantasy cultures, role-playing, and so many of the other things that these games can be about. There is no better way to bring out the cultures of your fantasy world than in putting a little thought into the cuisine. What do they eat? Why do they eat that? What impact should it have on your campaigns? This book answers all of those questions while filling your head with countless ideas for adventures and missions.

If you’re looking for a ton of new ideas, ideas you can easily use in your existing game world or use to craft a new game world, then Small Bites is what you’re looking for. Our goal is to take a subject, whether an archetype, a monster class, or some other FRPG theme and bring you as much content about it as we can. But this isn’t a simple one-shot supplement. We want to get you involved in the process - giving us the themes you want most, the articles you like the best, and the feedback we need to make you happy.

This is the “World Walker” edition. The Game Master edition gives you even more, including ideas about campaigns, enemy characters, and world building. We know that veteran and starting players and game masters are all going to find things they can use, and ideas to spark their characters, campaigns and game worlds! Come on - You’ve got nothing to lose!

boardgame.name: Poseidonis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Great Heroes Need Great Villains!

The South Pacific Island of Poseidonis is the new seat of world politics and epicenter of the Improbability Wave, the catalyst for new technologies, powers, heroes, and villains. Updating the Classic Supergame setting material, this supplement for Supergame Third Edition features:

15 ready to use heroes
14 ready to use villains
A base of operations for your stories
Lots of story ideas for inspiration
Random tables for even more inspiration
7 scenarios focusing on the island's power plant (choose one, mix and match, or serialize them)

boardgame.name: The Bridge at Dragon Chasm
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tread carefully across the ancient bridge

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting an ancient Dwarven bridge crossing a subterranean lava-filled chasm, stretching between two ruins.

Includes ruined bridge version - make your players jump across the lava!

boardgame.name: Innovaterr Plant 18-J15
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Slowly terraforming the planet, the Innovaterr Corp is committed to their work.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a terraforming station.

boardgame.name: March Hare
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

HOP TO IT!

Amelia, having found the former March Hare's accoutrements, and with the former March Hare currently in prison, she donned a suit, and used the villainous identity to become the hero she always dreamed of becoming. The new March Hare (PL 8) started a heroic career in the City of Angels.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

boardgame.name: Avara's Astounding Apothecary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventurers often need magical potions. But there’s nothing that says a potion maker has to be good at it! Here’s a useful thing to have in your GM’s Toolkit: an incompetent potion maker you can drop straight into your fantasy campaign.

Avara’s Astounding Apothecary is owned by none other than the illustrious Marzi Avara, a powerful mage and legendary potion maker (or so she claims). In reality Avara is a dangerous sociopath who enjoys mixing ingredients to see what random and unexpected fates befall her customers...

boardgame.name: The Fungal Kingdom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to 8-Bit Adventures! Do you yearn for a simple time, when video games scrolled right and you only had to deal with 2 buttons at a time? An era when blocky, colorful, vaguely recognizable shapes made up heroes that battled odd and often confusing villains with little to no context? Then Fat Goblin Games has you covered! This product is designed to take a nostalgic look at the iconic video games of the past and bring those adventures to life in your campaigns in the Tiny Dungeon Second Edition from Gallant Knight Games with all-new options.

This book covers the incursion of the Turtle Legions into the peaceful Fungal Kingdoms. The Turtle Legions have a variety of lethal troops at their disposal, ranging from the lowliest wrenchy raccoons all the way up to the imposing Turtle King himself. Most of the monsters included present optional variants to help encompass the vast array of foes found across the many incarnations of the Fungal Kingdom. These foes provide a wealth of options to challenge any adventurer.

The following tightly-themed 11-part adventure travels from royal castles to evil forests and burning plains, through haunted houses and across misty lakes, into the tropical jungle of a giant ape, to the heights of icy mountaintops, on to flying machines, and into dark fortresses on blasted landscapes.
Play as one of 6 new Heritages: peace-loving Fungifolk, voracious Hungry Dino, clever Little Ape, gelatinous Morphmello, regal Royals, or an industrious Working Class Hero.
Collect Coins and up to 10 different extraordinary items from enlarging mushrooms and feather tokens to firethrowing flowers and teleport flutes; or interact with special objects like exploding barrels, BANG! blocks, or breakaway stone!
Traverse threats both in monsters and in environmental hazards in the form of 15 different Environmental Traits that help Game Masters know the overall conditions and rules specific for any given area, space, or even specific threats in a location or level.
Includes full stat write-ups for 20 themed-monsters, many with variants totaling for an additional 21 threats, variants, and minions. Stomp on Evil Fungi, blast Turtle Soldiers with firethrowing flowers, prune back Barracuda Bushes, dodge Invulnerable Beetles, bust Scaredy Ghosts, and much, much more!

boardgame.name: Dragondaze
boardgame.description:
Dragon vs Dragon combat for 2-6 players. Card driven tactical board game with campaign (tournament) rules. Solitaire scenario (wyvern attack) included. First publicly played at the Dragondaze game convention, Newport, South Wales, UK, at which it went under the name "Dragon Skies"; renamed in honour of the convention.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Speak to me. The voices are far too loud.
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This game was written as a statement against bullying and against hate. This game was inspired by a powerful scene from writing legend Alan Moore and David Lloyd’s V for Vendetta. This game was also written as a protest and as a defiant stance against the hate which seems to currently fuel the world. We must embrace love. And this game hopes to allow opportunities to find that despite the bleakness the surround us.

This game might not be for everyone.
boardgame.rpg: Speak to me. The voices are far too loud.

boardgame.name: The Ghost Hack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You lived. You died. It didn't end there...

You're a ghost and you're still bound up in your Mortal Coils: people who need you, people who hate you, people and places you can't leave behind.

You have powers, the crafts of your ghostly Trade, along with the mighty Soulfire. But yet, you Rot. The Grave calls you. Days by day and year by year, your soul decays.

Perhaps the answer lies beyond the Living World, in Hades. There are Infernos there and Paradises too, cities of the Dead and mysteries to solve.

Can you survive your own death?

Welcome to The Ghost Hack, a a new take on the '90s games that let you roleplay the monster! In The Ghost Hack you will find:


Four different classes of ghost to choose from
A range of crafts your ghost can use
Rules for your Mortal Coil that ties you to the Living World
Usage die mechanics to cover the power of your Soul, the extent of your Rot and the health of your mortal attachments
Rules for combat, chases, NPC antagonists, the realm of Hades and different styles of play
A nice character sheet and flow charts

boardgame.name: The Ghost Hack Quick Character Creation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Banshees yearn to feel emotion and emotion is their weapon.

Nightmanes turn away from the living to explore the mysteries of Hades.

Poltergeists remember how to touch - and how to destroy!

Revenants are slaves to the flesh - and know how to return to it.

Create PCs for The Ghost Hack in moments or minutes with these four templates and a fillable PDF character sheet.

boardgame.name: Hell Hath No Fury
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You forget about me

I didn't forget about you

We're going to be together soon

Forever

An introductory scenario for THE GHOST HACK and other RPGs where you roleplay a ghost. Jill York is someone who matters to you, but she's under attack from a powerful spirit. Saving Jill will take you throughout the haunted city and into the realm of Hades and back. Suitable for 2-6 players.

boardgame.name: Beneath the Ruined Wizard's Tower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fen Orc presents an unofficial sequel to the classic 1977 Sample Dungeon for the world's first Fantasy Roleplaying Game.


The haunted caves where Smugglers hide their contraband and the Undead Corsair whose tomb has been disturbed
The Temple of the Rat God and the sinister secret society that has infiltrated the unsuspecting town above
The ancient Pre-human City where a foolhardy Wizard unearthed something that destroyed his Tower, fifty years ago, and guarded by its own deadly occupants


The scenario includes a 40-location map, key and illustrations as well as 'Optional' text boxes to advise new Referees and players how to introduce greater complexity to these encounters. The adventure can be played as a direct sequel to the 1977 Sample Dungeon or as a stand-alone scenario for 2nd level characters using any OSR rules set.

boardgame.name: The Fen Orc Almanac 2020
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fen Orc presents six one-shot scenarios for Classic and Old School Fantasy RPGs. Each will fill a session, all are suitable for starting character and full notes for the GM include maps, PC motivations, NPC tactics, monster abilities, secrets and descriptive text.


A sinister undead-worshiping cult want you to go into one of their crypts to head off a team of tomb robbers before they rouse something hideous from its unquiet sleep!
A tyrannical pirate captain leaves you the map of the island where he buried his greatest treasure!
Can you stop the Vampyr Margrave from marrying the Duchess before the sun sets?
Can you lead your Goblin Tribe to freedom against the oppressive Elfin Empire?
A mysterious Inn with no guests where you are trapped awaiting the ominous Cold Companion...
A romantic comedy where you must play Cupid for a Dwarf lady's love-triangle...


Every scenario has a Background, Hook, full key to a 10-location Map, Epilogue and Appendices with suggestions on how the plot could unfold differently.

boardgame.name: White Box: Unearthed Trove
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

White Box: Unearthed Trove is a supplement for White Box and is compatible with any other Swords & Wizardry game. It adds:


Three new character classes: the Assassin, the Illusionist and the Ranger. Each of them is designed to be simple and in the same fashion as the original White Box classes.
New races: Gnomes and Half-Orcs and their multi-classes: Fighter-Thieves, Thief-Illusionists and Cleric-Assassins
Combat Tactics for characters not involved in melee, missiles or spell-casting
Optional rules: Psionics which streamline the 1970s rules and Trauma to calculate psychological grind and derangement


User summary:

Intended for use with White Box: Expanded Lore

boardgame.name: Revelations
boardgame.description:
Revelations is the new version of the adult stand-alone sequel to Feelinks. After the success of Feelinks, the first adult party game with the emotions as a theme comes back with a more powerful rule.

Revelations is fully cooperative and plays in about 30 minutes for 2 to 8 players. While never being rude or inappropriate, this sassy game presents over 300 situations intended for adults and teenagers over 16.

During a game, you:


Pick a card and choose a situation to read.
Choose the emotion that matches how you feel
Choose a player whose emotion you want to guess
Take a step for each emotion correctly guessed among the players
Proceed to the next situation.


As the main course of a romantic evening or as the dessert of good game night with friends, Revelations will test how well players know each other...

Will you reach the top of the empathy track ?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sprucemere Fishing Hamlet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sprucemere fishing hamlet is a premade, drop in community, located on a freshwater lake by the same name. Playable as an inhabited or abandoned locale, this ready to print hamlet offers a unique experience.

Featuring:

Four full colour maps (2 Players and 2 Game Masters versions)
Community statistics
A detailed list of locations
2 versions of background information (Inhabited or Abandoned)


Drop this fishing hamlet into any campaign and watch as it becomes a memorable favorite.

boardgame.name: Tibom
boardgame.description:
Tibom is a fun and fast-paced game where you have to get rid of all your letter cards by matching them to the category on the table quicker than everyone else. Make other players draw cards by winning duels and playing special cards and be careful with the Time Bomb!!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Interceptor
boardgame.description:
Government officials are plotting to undermine democracy! They need to exchange documents and money in secret, but a pair of investigative journalists are getting suspicious of their activities. Will the intrepid reporters be able to expose the corruption before it's too late?

Two corrupt politicians need to exchange messages and dirty money while two investigators try to intercept their actions and publish them in the international media.

Winner of Button Shy's 18 identical cards challenge, Interceptor is a game for 4 people in pairs that will sit facing your partner.

The cards have two sides: money or message. Players must place one of their 5 cards with one side forward and make a pre-arranged secret code for their partner to place the same side forward. Corruptors should try to avoid investigations by placing the opposite side that their opponents put, while investigators want to put on the same side as their opponents.

After 4 cards on the table, they are all revealed and losers lose their cards. Whoever runs out of cards loses the game.

But there is one more thing. If you discover your opponent's code, you can say "Interceptor!" and make a guess. If you're wrong, you lose a card, if you get it right, you win the game instantly.

It is a fast and very fun game, great for playing several games in a row.

—description from the designer


Winner of Button Shy's 18 Card Challenge: Design a game with 18 identical cards.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

boardgame.name: Construction BOOM!
boardgame.description:
Construction BOOM! is a strategic two-player tile-laying game made at the Institute of Digital Games (University of Malta). It is a playable satire of the unrestrained residential construction in Malta, and a criticism of the "BOOMING" real-estate business on our little island.

In the game, you take on the role of construction tycoons in Malta, strategizing and sabotaging to complete your building contract and rake in the cash.

The standard game of Construction BOOM! has four rounds. The contractor needs to have placed a certain amount of one type of material on the board by the end of the round. They're penalized when they fail. The saboteur will try and make those penalties accumulate by, for example, placing roofs in inconvenient places or by overloading buildings. The tile types, materials, and weights govern the placement rules.

A round finishes when neither player has any more cards to play or when there are two consecutive passes. At the end of the round if the contractor makes their contract they get points, if not, they lose points — which is great news for the saboteur!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: To Live and Die in Byzantium
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Then Romulus shall receive the sceptre of his race, and found the walls of Mars, and call the people Romans. I have given no limits or duration to their possessions: I've given them empire without end."
Virgil, Aeneid

In Lex Arcana, you are a Custos (warden) of the Cohors Auxiliaria Arcana, sent by the Emperor to the four corners of the world to further the study of arcane lore, investigate forbidden cults, and face the thread posed by dangerous supernatural creatures.

Why Velleius, a former centurion and a veteran of three war campaign, killed three vigiles? What is the hidden mystery behind this story?

This PDF contains:

a detailed map of Byzantium, the Empire’s second largest city
a deep description of the city and a table of events about *The Golden Horn, the giant port of Byzantium, to create your one-shot adventure
a long adventure set in the city and in the Arena of the Gods!


Enjoy the Cohors Auxiliaria Arcana!

boardgame.name: Fen of the Frog King
boardgame.description:
From The Title Page:

"When the Lady Elena was caught in the arms of a local minstrel, the young knight, Solovius of Monrovia ordered the bard to be executed. But, cooler heads prevailed, and the knight was convinced to banish the crooner to the fetid swamps to the south. Thinking it not enough, punishment, the knight summoned his trusted advisor and alchemist to create a concoction that would transform the charming minstrel into something so hideous, that no human woman would find him desirous again. Then, shackled and taken south, the bard was left for dead in the fetid fen.

50 years have passed. What became of the poor soul?

And why has Lady Elena suddenly boarded a private coach heading south?

boardgame.name: Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm: Volume 5 (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm is the largest, most comprehensive, most flexible, and most ambitious fantasy roleplaying bestiary ever conceived. 6,400 complete statblocks, comprising 1,600 monsters, each given the Quadded Statblock treatment, enabling them to be used in any campaign setting, with PCs of any level.

Add to this a thoroughly innovative and massively expandable AI system to guide monster behavior, and you have what just might be the most impressive and valuable creature resource ever to hit Pathfinder and 5E.

(Please note that Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm in its entirety is a six-volume set. This publication is the fifth of those six volumes, and contains 1,064 statblocks comprising 266 monsters. This book may be used in combination with any number of the other volumes, or on its own.)

This book is intended to be any or all of the following:

An authoritative listing of monsters for use in any campaign setting, for adventuring parties of any size, and any level.
A means of using any existing monster with adventures of any level and difficulty.
A compendium of newly-created monsters, born of inspiration from existing beasties you may already know and love.
A single-source reference and repository, listing every single possible monster in easy-to-reference alphabetical order.

boardgame.name: Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm: Volume 5 (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm is the largest, most comprehensive, most flexible, and most ambitious fantasy roleplaying bestiary ever conceived. 6,400 complete statblocks, comprising 1,600 monsters, each given the Quadded Statblock treatment, enabling them to be used in any campaign setting, with PCs of any level.

Add to this a thoroughly innovative and massively expandable AI system to guide monster behavior, and you have what just might be the most impressive and valuable creature resource ever to hit Pathfinder and 5E.

(Please note that Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm in its entirety is a six-volume set. This publication is the fifth of those six volumes, and contains 1,064 statblocks comprising 266 monsters. This book may be used in combination with any number of the other volumes, or on its own.)

This book is intended to be any or all of the following:

An authoritative listing of monsters for use in any campaign setting, for adventuring parties of any size, and any level.
A means of using any existing monster with adventures of any level and difficulty.
A compendium of newly-created monsters, born of inspiration from existing beasties you may already know and love.
A single-source reference and repository, listing every single possible monster in easy-to-reference alphabetical order.

boardgame.name: Classic '77: Expanded Rules
boardgame.description:
From The Cover:

Rules For Medieval Fantasy Role Playing Using Pencil And Paper And Lead Miniatures
